column9: I took this for the prevention of migraines that I have battled for 8 years and it was a MIRACLE DRUG for me! However, I had to stop taking it after a year because I had two kidney stones shortly after I started this medication. It is supposed to be rare, but my doctor believes that the Zonisamide caused them. I AM SO SAD because I hardly had any migraines while on this and if I did, they did not last long at all. My urologist doesn't think they caused them, so I am going to find a second opinion from another Neurologist so maybe I can get back on it ASAP! I am getting migraines again without it :(

column9: I have fibromyalgia, and have been taking Lyrica 150mg 3 x's daily for a while.  My pain Dr. has been trying to find an add on that will help with my leg pain.  We tried a regimen of Savella.  It helped my R.L.S. a little, but seemed ineffective against my pain.  He now has me on Zonisamide 100mg 1/daily.  I have been taking it for a little over a week.  I know it is too early to know if it will help, but already, my R.L.S. and leg pain at night seem to be worse.  I have been experiencing hair loss for about as long as I have been on Lyrica.  I don't know if it is the Lyrica or the stress from the pain.

column1: Additional Medication to Treat Partial Seizures
column2: Bird, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My non-verbal son is taking Zonegran 50mg 3 times a day for 6 months now, because his meds (Trileptal & Keppra) didn't fully control his seizure. Zonegran helps control his seizure better but he started hitting his head, I gave him Biotin 2500 mcg twice a day and he stops hitting his head, so my guess is all the seizure medications he took so far depleted his Biotin somehow. (By the way, Biotin helps with reducing hair loss so if any of you having hair loss while using Zonegran may try to see if adding Biotin supplement helps?)

column2: Ed, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had a seizure in 07 and was put on Topamax (bad on brain),then Depakote (bad on brain), then Zonegran (Zonisamide) good on brain.  This prevented the seizure and cut my Migraines to 1/3 of premed level.  Started on 100Mg and worked up to 400Mg (all(4)taken in the morning to prevent any sleep loss as this dose can keep me awake if taken at night) All is now good for me and it will soon be 2011.  I hope this will work for others.

column2: dutchess, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column9: I have suffered from migraines for 14 years now and have taken countless medications and currently take 100 mg of Zonisamide twice a day, once in the morning and at night. So far I have not noticed any side effects.  To be fair, I will write more later to see if my opinion has changed.  I have learned though some of my triggeres for migraines are:  bananas, peanut butter, hot dogs, sausage, certain preservatives in frozen foods such as tomato sauces & brown cinnamon sugar pop tarts.  I hops that this helps someone out there.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This drug was somewhat difficult to start. Some early symptoms included fuzzy thinking and mood swings. After a few weeks, these subsided. The drug worked great with minimal side effects and few issues through the birth of our first child. Problems began about 1 year ago when I experienced a few petit maul seizures. The medication levels were adjusted upwards with good results. While pregnant with the 2nd child, symptoms returned, but were controlled with increasing dosages to maintain the same blood levels. Following the birth of the second child (doing well), I went into status and am looking for a new medication. Our main complaint is that zonisamide does not seem to be a good long term solution since I built up a tolerance to the drug. FYI treatment for juvenile myoclonic epilepsy.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: When I was 18 my drivers licences was taken from me due to epileptic seizures. For 5 years I had to ask for rides to work, the store, or even just across town. In the course of those 5 years I would have sometimes 10 seizures a day, 3-4 times a week it is amazing i'm even still alive. In the spring of 08 I went to see a new specialtist she prescribed me 400 mg of zonisamide. she told me it would take at least 4-6 weeks to fully be in my system. during the first month of treatment I seized once 2 months later a very mild one so my wife says it is now the summer of 2010 and I have my drivers licence again. After the neorologist did his testing he said something I will never forget.There seems to be no sign of seizure activity. Thank you zonisamide

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i have been on this med since august of 09. i have had  migraines since i was 12. am 28 now. was fed everykind of pain med, nothing worked, finally started having seizures bout 4 yrs ago, went to the dr and he said my siezures were because my brain couldnt handle my migraines any longer and was shutting down, yeah huh? right? so he put me on this zonisamide. i have only have one siezure since august but my migraines have almost completly stopped. i am always tired onthis med though thats for sure. i take 300 mg at nite when i go to bed and i dint move when i sleep. i dont dream. im moody bad for about an hour when i wake. i  have lost bout 20 pds sinces starting this med. i notice numbness in my fingertips and hands. sometimes i cant find words and i stand and look stupid trying to think of a word or sentence, but to me it is all worth it if i dont have to worry bout migraines or siezures. i havent noticed any hair loss (knock on wood). i have noticed moodiness sometimes.  but lke all meds it has its ups and downs.to me it lets me live without lying in the dark crying in pain, or convulsining on the floor so i will take the side effects.

column2: neesie2120, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: phoenixrose23@yahoo.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medicine is a double edged sword.  It works great on contoling my seziures, but I have to sleep about 10 hrs a day just to be able to function properly.  I have lost about 30 lbs and have NO appitite whatsoever and have had to resort to drinking nutritional suppliments (ick).  My memory is as good as gone, I think it took a vacation with my hair, which is disappearing at an alarming rate.  On a good note, these side effects are a lot better than some of the other epilepsy meds out there.  After being on 300mg a day for 6 months, I show a 70-80% improvement in my seziure activity!  This works great if you can keep the side effects under control.  Especially the nutritional aspect of it, if it affects your appatite.  Good luck everyone!

column2: bellesbark, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I began taking this drug approx. 6 yrs ago.  Extremely new to me then and is still new to many physicians I've since encountered.  It is a part of a medication cocktail that I take daily.  I take 100 mg. b4 bed - I have not experienced a problem with it so far.  Re: hair falling out... My hair has been falling out for a long long time now.  I also take Depakoke ER and I have been on many other anti-convulsants that I believe to have contributed to that issue.  I'm not surprised the medication might have that side-effect.  A good person to ask is your pharmacist.  I've been lucky - my pharmacists have always been eager to share information.  Oh, and I've been taking anti-seizure meds for 37 years...I still have a head of hair.. :)Just keep the doctor informed if the hair loss gets too too extreme.  :)  All the best!!!  Bellesbark

column2: plastic, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication since the beginning of August for Migraines.I started taking just 1 capsule of the 100mg at bedtime. and every 2 weeks I increase. column2: little seizure, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I began taking this medication last year for my temporal lobe epilepsy. I started off taking one 100 mg pill a day and slowly incresed to one pill 5 times a day, so basically every 3 hours. Now, I am up to 500 mg a day. I know this seems like a lot but this pill is so effective with no side effects I don't mind taking the pill so often. I went from having 3-10 horrific headaches a week following seizures to having MAYBE one a month now. Its a rare event for me to have break through seizures. This is my magic pill and it has given me my life back.

column9: My husband had lymphoma with three brain tumors. The cancer is gone but "transformative" migraines appeared. He was on topomax and gabapentin. Now he is taking Zonisamide in addition. He will stop Topomax when he gets up to 150 mg of Zonisamide. This is a lot of antiseizure meds. Docs want him to stop topomax because of diarrhea and weight loss. As he increases the amount of Zonisamide, he is becoming increasingly agitated at night and is very hungry at night. He can't sleep even with Ambien and he eats several times a night. Headaches are 2 on a scale of 10 but he is very groggy and cannot work. If anyone can share tips, please email ellen.madaline@gmail.com
